title: Visualisation
text: may like display grade distributions academic data. data already set factor levels major grades, also colour palettes use; csu_colours, csu_colours_dark csu_colours_light.

what: Basic grade distribution in Charles Sturt colours
title: Visualisation
code: academic |>      add_grade_helpers() |>      filter(grade_substantive) |>      ggplot(aes(x = grade, fill = grade_success)) +     geom_histogram(stat = "count") +     theme_minimal() +     scale_fill_manual(values = csu_colours, guide = NULL) #> Warning in geom_histogram(stat = "count"): Ignoring unknown parameters: #> `binwidth`, `bins`, and `pad`

what: Using facets to compare grade distributions
title: Visualisation
text: may also want compare grade distributions different groups. instance, table flags interventions include data students flagged concern various campaigns, immediate results intervention. toy data included package simulated sample based pre-census campaign students called flagged ‘-risk’. answer phone call, .
code: academic |>      inner_join( # only including subjects from the flags list         flags |>              distinct(subject)     ) |>      left_join(         flags |>              mutate(flagged = TRUE)     ) |>      mutate(flagged = replace_na(flagged, FALSE)) |>      mutate(grp = if_else(flagged, "Low engagement", "Engaged")) |>      add_grade_helpers() |>      filter(grade_substantive) |>      ggplot(aes(x = grade, fill = grade_success)) +     geom_histogram(stat = "count") +     theme_minimal() +     scale_fill_manual(values = csu_colours, guide = NULL) +     facet_wrap(~grp, scales = "free_y") #> Joining, by = "subject" #> Joining, by = c("id", "subject") #> Warning in geom_histogram(stat = "count"): Ignoring unknown parameters: #> `binwidth`, `bins`, and `pad` academic |>      inner_join( # only including subjects from the flags list         flags |>              distinct(subject)     ) |>      left_join(         flags |>              mutate(flagged = TRUE)     ) |>      mutate(flagged = replace_na(flagged, FALSE)) |>      left_join(interventions) |>      mutate(grp = case_when(         !flagged ~ "Engaged",         intervention_result == "dialogue" ~ "Spoke with disengaged student",         intervention_result == "no dialogue" ~ "Disengaged student did not answer") |>              fct_relevel("Engaged", "Spoke with disengaged student")) |>      add_grade_helpers() |>      filter(grade_substantive) |>      ggplot(aes(x = grade, fill = grp, alpha = grade_success)) +     geom_histogram(stat = "count") +     theme_minimal() +     scale_fill_manual(values = csu_colours, guide = NULL) +     scale_alpha_discrete(range = c(1, 0.5), guide = NULL) +     facet_wrap(~grp, scales = "free_y") #> Joining, by = "subject" #> Joining, by = c("id", "subject") #> Joining, by = "id" #> Warning in geom_histogram(stat = "count"): Ignoring unknown parameters: #> `binwidth`, `bins`, and `pad` #> Warning: Using alpha for a discrete variable is not advised.

title: Working-with-academic-data
text: series useful functions prefix add_grade_*. function add_grade_helpers adds data frame grade field: Note grade_zf grade_npe identical. sometimes used term Zero-fail Non-Participating Enrolment indicate thing - failing grade student also received mark 0 (FNS grade). want particular field appended data frame use add_grade_* instead: instance, might want count grade distribution substantive (finalised counting towards progress)
code: some_sample_grades <-      tibble(grade = c("FL", "FNS", "PS", "PS", "HD", "GP", "ZZ"))  some_sample_grades |>      add_grade_helpers() #> # A tibble: 7 × 7 #>   grade grade_substantive grade_success grade_gpa grade_fail grade_zf grade_npe #>   <chr> <lgl>             <lgl>         <lgl>     <lgl>      <lgl>    <lgl>     #> 1 FL    TRUE              FALSE         TRUE      TRUE       FALSE    FALSE     #> 2 FNS   TRUE              FALSE         TRUE      TRUE       TRUE     TRUE      #> 3 PS    TRUE              TRUE          TRUE      FALSE      FALSE    FALSE     #> 4 PS    TRUE              TRUE          TRUE      FALSE      FALSE    FALSE     #> 5 HD    TRUE              TRUE          TRUE      FALSE      FALSE    FALSE     #> 6 GP    FALSE             FALSE         FALSE     FALSE      FALSE    FALSE     #> 7 ZZ    FALSE             FALSE         FALSE     FALSE      FALSE    FALSE some_sample_grades |>      add_grade_substantive() |>      add_grade_success() #> # A tibble: 7 × 3 #>   grade grade_substantive grade_success #>   <chr> <lgl>             <lgl>         #> 1 FL    TRUE              FALSE         #> 2 FNS   TRUE              FALSE         #> 3 PS    TRUE              TRUE          #> 4 PS    TRUE              TRUE          #> 5 HD    TRUE              TRUE          #> 6 GP    FALSE             FALSE         #> 7 ZZ    FALSE             FALSE

title: Working-with-academic-data
text: helpers can used calculate aggregates grades, progress rates GPA (using gpa function). Additionally, function retention.helpers::summarise_academic() aggregates set grades two descriptions, result result_long. makes sense use grouped data frame.
code: some_sample_grades |>      add_grade_helpers() |>      summarise(         progress_rate = sum(grade_success) / sum(grade_substantive),         gpa = gpa(grade)     ) #> # A tibble: 1 × 2 #>   progress_rate   gpa #>           <dbl> <dbl> #> 1           0.6     5 tibble(     student = c("A", "A", "B", "B", "B"),     grade = c("PS", "DI", "FNS", "FL", "PS")) |>      group_by(student) |>      summarise_academic() #> # A tibble: 2 × 3 #>   student result_long       result     #>   <chr>   <fct>             <fct>      #> 1 A       Pass all          Pass       #> 2 B       Failing (some ZF) Partial ZF

title: Working-with-enrolments
text: Enrolments come two levels Charles Sturt University; course subject. Course enrolments refer students’ enrolment particular program study, Bachelor Nursing. stored student_course table. Subject level enrolments stored enrolments table, correspond enrolment records units study particular session. match academic table stores grades subject taken (student remained past census date).

title: Working-with-enrolments
text: enrolments tables also includes pseudo-subjects, place holders Leave Absence. ‘subjects’ code XLV0000 treated like normal subject. Subjects beginning code SSS… might also needed treated differently, free subjects exhibit different behaviour students.

title: Working-with-enrolments
text: example, set toy version student_course enrolments tables. rename match names used (private) data.csu.retention package. might want look active enrolments particular session. might also interested course students . toy data primarily Bachelor Nursing, however joining directly student_course table can produce errors student multiple courses. need select appropriate course, based admit_session (student entered course - however warned sometimes later first subjects course!), last_registered_session. might necessary ignore course_code field can multiple course codes single course.
code: student_course <- retention.helpers::toy_student_course enrolments <- retention.helpers::toy_enrolments  glimpse(student_course) #> Rows: 11 #> Columns: 11 #> $ id                      <chr> "Student1", "Student2", "Student3", "Student1"… #> $ course                  <chr> "Bachelor of Nursing", "Bachelor of Nursing", … #> $ course_code             <chr> "4415NS", "4415NS", "4415NS", "4415NS", "4421F… #> $ course_level            <chr> "Bachelors Pass", "Bachelors Pass", "Bachelors… #> $ course_faculty          <chr> "FOSH", "FOSH", "FOSH", "FOSH", "FOSH", "FOSH"… #> $ basis_of_admission      <chr> "A VET award course or VET delivered enabling … #> $ admit_session           <dbl> 202130, 202130, 202130, 202130, 202230, 202160… #> $ catalog_year            <dbl> 2021, 2021, 2021, 2021, 2022, 2021, 2021, 2022… #> $ last_registered_session <dbl> NA, 202260, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, 202230, 202260… #> $ points_att              <dbl> 0, 192, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 72, 40, 0, 144 #> $ points_comp             <dbl> 0, 176, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 72, 40, 0, 72 glimpse(enrolments) #> Rows: 65 #> Columns: 6 #> $ id            <chr> "Student1", "Student1", "Student2", "Student2", "Student… #> $ session       <dbl> 202160, 202160, 202230, 202230, 202230, 202260, 202130, … #> $ subject       <chr> "NRS160", "NRS163", "NRS312", "NRS312", "NRS313", "NRS32… #> $ offering      <chr> "NRS160_202160_B_D", "NRS163_202160_B_D", "NRS312_202230… #> $ enrol_date    <dttm> 2021-05-06, 2021-05-06, 2021-12-08, 2021-12-08, 2021-11… #> $ withdraw_date <dttm> 2021-06-09, 2021-06-09, NA, 2021-12-14, NA, NA, NA, 202… # gets all enrolments, and counts by student enrolments |>      filter(session == 202230) |>      count(id, sort = T) |>      rename(n_subjects = n) #> # A tibble: 3 × 2 #>   id       n_subjects #>   <chr>         <int> #> 1 Student2          3 #> 2 Student4          2 #> 3 Student5          2  # gets only those who remained in the subject, then counts by student enrolments |>      filter(session == 202230,             is.na(withdraw_date) # exluding those that have withdrawn            ) |>      count(id, sort = T) |>      rename(n_subjects = n) #> # A tibble: 1 × 2 #>   id       n_subjects #>   <chr>         <int> #> 1 Student2          2 enrolments |>      filter(session == 202230) |>      distinct(id, session) |>      inner_join(         student_course |>              select(id, course, course_code,                     admit_session, last_registered_session)) #> Joining, by = "id" #> # A tibble: 6 × 6 #>   id       session course                                cours…¹ admit…² last_…³ #>   <chr>      <dbl> <chr>                                 <chr>     <dbl>   <dbl> #> 1 Student2  202230 Bachelor of Nursing                   4415NS   202130  202260 #> 2 Student4  202230 Bachelor of Nursing                   4415NS   202130      NA #> 3 Student4  202230 Bachelor of Nursing                   4421NS   202230  202230 #> 4 Student5  202230 Bachelor of Business (with specialis… 2421BU   202260  202260 #> 5 Student5  202230 Bachelor of Social Science (Psycholo… 2421SS   202230      NA #> 6 Student5  202230 Bachelor of Nursing                   4415NS   202130  202130 #> # … with abbreviated variable names ¹​course_code, ²​admit_session, #> #   ³​last_registered_session students_in_202230 <-      enrolments |>      filter(session == 202230) |>      distinct(id, session) |>      inner_join(         student_course |>              select(id, course, course_code,                     admit_session, last_registered_session)) |>      group_by(id, session) |>     filter(         # exclude any courses if already completed         last_registered_session >= session | is.na(last_registered_session),         # exclude if they entered the course after the session of interest         admit_session <= session         ) |>      distinct(id, session, course) |>      ungroup() #> Joining, by = "id"  students_in_202230 #> # A tibble: 3 × 3 #>   id       session course                                  #>   <chr>      <dbl> <chr>                                   #> 1 Student2  202230 Bachelor of Nursing                     #> 2 Student4  202230 Bachelor of Nursing                     #> 3 Student5  202230 Bachelor of Social Science (Psychology)

title: Authors and Citation
text: Hicks B (2023). retention.helpers: Munging, visualisation analysis helper functions. R package version 0.2.0, https://benwhicks.github.io/retention.helpers/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {retention.helpers: Munging, visualisation and analysis helper functions},   author = {Ben Hicks},   year = {2023},   note = {R package version 0.2.0},   url = {https://benwhicks.github.io/retention.helpers/}, }

what: Munging, visualisation and analysis helper functions
title: Munging, visualisation and analysis helper functions
text: goal retention.helpers provide functions help working CSU Retention Team’s data set, within R environment.

title: Munging, visualisation and analysis helper functions
text: can install development version GitHub : also tidyverse installed loaded get package: best way interface data data.csu.retention package. package shared publicly, need obtain copy R Package build package . done RStudio using Ctrl-Shift-B going Build pane (usually top right along Environment) selecting Install Restart.

title: Munging, visualisation and analysis helper functions
text: functions split groups based use prefix. main families add_ read_.

title: Munging, visualisation and analysis helper functions
text: add_ family functions create new columns data frame based data table . means broadly useful require retention.data loaded. example offering data frame (form ABC123_201990_W_D) can extract subject ABC123, session 201990 year 2019.
code: # Given some data with offering dat_with_offering <- tibble(   offering = c("MTH100_189030_P_D", "PHL105_189060_B_I") )  dat_with_offering #> # A tibble: 2 × 1 #>   offering          #>   <chr>             #> 1 MTH100_189030_P_D #> 2 PHL105_189060_B_I  # Add in subject and year from offering dat_with_offering %>%    add_subject_from_offering() %>%    add_year_from_offering() #> # A tibble: 2 × 3 #>   offering          subject  year #>   <chr>             <chr>   <dbl> #> 1 MTH100_189030_P_D MTH100   1890 #> 2 PHL105_189060_B_I PHL105   1890

title: Munging, visualisation and analysis helper functions
text: read_* style functions operate similar fashion read_csv tidyverse, expect designed read particular commonly used files clean process.

title: Munging, visualisation and analysis helper functions
text: package designed work retention data set.

title: Munging, visualisation and analysis helper functions
text: also sample data available (simulated resampled original data, represent actual student data). tables included package start prefix toy_. two sets tables match. first toy data set includes toy_academic, toy_enrolments toy_student_course. second set includes toy_academic_for_interventions, toy_flags toy_interventions.
code: glimpse(toy_academic) #> Rows: 19 #> Columns: 7 #> $ id             <chr> "Student2", "Student2", "Student2", "Student2", "Studen… #> $ session        <dbl> 202230, 202230, 202260, 202130, 202130, 202160, 202160,… #> $ subject        <chr> "NRS312", "NRS313", "NRS327", "BMS291", "NRS211", "NRS2… #> $ offering       <chr> "NRS312_202230_B_D", "NRS313_202230_B_D", "NRS327_20226… #> $ grade          <chr> "PS", "DI", "DI", "CR", "CR", "CR", "DI", "DI", "DI", "… #> $ mark_bb        <dbl> 0.6300, 0.7700, NA, 0.7220, 0.7080, 0.6600, 0.7560, 0.8… #> $ grade_original <chr> "PS", "DI", "DI", "CR", "CR", "CR", "DI", "DI", "DI", "…

title: Munging, visualisation and analysis helper functions
Munging, visualisation and analysis helper functions
text: vignettes get started, : Visualisation data Working enrolment data Working academic data

title: add enrolled — add_enrolled
text: d data frame id, offering withdraw_date

title: add GPA — add_gpa_by
text: Takes data frame grade variables grouping returns data frame grouping variables gpa.

title: add GPA — add_gpa_by
text: d data frame ... grouping variables, passed group_by

title: add grade fail — add_grade_fail
text: Takes data frame grade variable returns data frame grade_fail variable, true grade FW, FL FNS; false otherwise.

title: add grade finalised — add_grade_finalised
text: Takes data frame grade variable returns data frame grade_finalised variable, true grade FW, FL, PS, CR, DI HD; false otherwise.

title: add grade gpa — add_grade_gpa
text: Adds grade_gpa column data frame, based grade column. Grades count towards GPA substantive grades (key difference AW grades)

title: add grade helpers — add_grade_helpers
text: Takes data frame grade variable returns data frame series grade_* variables assist analysing grade data.

title: add grade Non-Participating Enrolment (NPE) — add_grade_npe
text: Takes data frame grade variable returns data frame grade_npe variable, true grade FW FNS; false otherwise. Identical add_grade_zf.

title: add grade pass — add_grade_pass
text: Takes data frame grade variable returns data frame grade_pass variable, true grade PS, CR, DI HD; false otherwise.

title: add grade substantive — add_grade_substantive
text: Adds grade_substantive column data frame, based grade column. substantive grade included denominator calculating progress rates.

title: add grade success — add_grade_success
text: Adds grade_success column data frame, based grade column.

title: add grade Zero Fail (ZF) — add_grade_zf
text: Takes data frame grade variable returns data frame grade_zf variable, true grade FW FNS; false otherwise. Identical add_grade_npe.

title: add remained past census — add_remained_past_census
text: d data frame id, session offering

title: add remained past census — add_remained_past_census
text: Adds boolean field student past census. remove

title: add session from offering — add_session_from_offering
text: Takes data frame offering variable returns data frame session variable. Requires offering format ABC123_201930_W_D, return 201930 session.

title: add subject context — add_subject_context
text: Requires data frame subject (six character code), n_remained (NA subject HEPPP last year), genuine_pass_rate, n_passed,  same_trigger (boolean) also three fields describing subject runs, s1, s2 s3. sn fields set internal, distance . blank (NA) deemed unknown subject run next.

title: add subject context — add_subject_context
code: d <- tibble::tribble(    ~subject, ~genuine_pass_rate, ~n_remained, ~n_passed, ~same_trigger, ~s1, ~s2, ~s3,    "MEH111", NA_real_, NA, NA, NA, "both", "internal", "internal",    "NUP200", 0.88, 18, 3, TRUE, NA_character_, "both", NA_character_,    "LOL101", 0.71, 15, 0, FALSE, "distance", "distance", "distance" ) d |> add_subject_context() #> Error in dplyr::mutate(., subject_context = stringr::str_c(subject, dplyr::if_else(!is.na(n_remained),     " was in last years campaign. ", " was not in last years campaign."),     dplyr::if_else(is.na(genuine_pass_rate), "", stringr::str_c(" Around ",         round(genuine_pass_rate/0.05) * 5, "% of students who submit at least 1 assessment end up passing.")),     dplyr::if_else(is.na(n_remained), "", dplyr::if_else(n_remained ==         0, "No students in a similar position last year remained past census date.",         stringr::str_c(" Last year ", n_remained, if_else(n_remained ==             1, " student", " students"), " who were in ", dplyr::if_else(same_trigger,             "the same", "a similar"), " position remained enrolled past census and ",             dplyr::if_else(n_passed == 0, "none of them passed.",                 stringr::str_c(n_passed, " of them passed (",                   round(100 * n_passed/n_remained), "%)."))))),     dplyr::if_else((is.na(s1) & is.na(s2) & is.na(s3)), "It is unclear when this subject is run next.",         stringr::str_c(" This subject runs in:", dplyr::case_when(is.na(s1) ~             "", s1 == "both" ~ " Session 1 (internal and distance)",             s1 == "internal" ~ " Session 1 (internal only)",             s1 == "distance" ~ " Session 1 (distance only)"),             dplyr::case_when(is.na(s2) ~ "", s2 == "both" ~ " Session 2 (internal and distance)",                 s2 == "internal" ~ " Session 2 (internal only)",                 s2 == "distance" ~ " Session 2 (distance only)"),             dplyr::case_when(is.na(s3) ~ "", s3 == "both" ~ " Session 3 (internal and distance)",                 s3 == "internal" ~ " Session 3 (internal only)",                 s3 == "distance" ~ " Session 3 (distance only)"))),     ".")): Problem while computing `subject_context = stringr::str_c(...)`. #> Caused by error in `if_else()`: #> ! could not find function "if_else"

title: add subject from offering — add_subject_from_offering
text: Takes data frame offering variable returns data frame subject variable. Requires offering format ABC123_201930_W_D, return ABC123 subject.

title: add year from offering — add_year_from_offering
text: Takes data frame offering variable returns data frame year variable. Requires offering format ABC123_201930_W_D return 2019

title: add year from session — add_year_from_session
text: Takes data frame session variable returns data frame year variable. Requires session format 201930

title: chi and odds — chi_and_odds
text: Takes n x 3 data frame calculates chi squared statistic, p-value odds ratio. First column must category names. Second column must observed values (count) Third column must expected values (also count, can weights probabilities)

title: chi and odds — chi_and_odds
text: m n x 3 data frame tibble. variables particular order: category_name, observed_count, expected_count

title: chi and odds — chi_and_odds
code: df <- tibble::tibble(field = c('Yes', 'No') , observed = c(34, 88), expected = c(707, 1021)) chi_and_odds(df) #> # A tibble: 2 × 3 #>   field observed expected #>   <chr>    <dbl>    <dbl> #> 1 Yes         34      707 #> 2 No          88     1021 #>  #> $chisq.test.result #>  #> 	Chi-squared test for given probabilities #>  #> data:  observed #> X-squared = 8.5886, df = 1, p-value = 0.003383 #>  #>  #> $odds_ratio #>    observed #> 1 0.5579594 #>  #> $odds_interpretation #> [1] "Yes is 1.79224520366423 times less likely to happen in observed than in expected" #>   # or from clipboard df <- clipr::read_clip_tbl() #> Error in error_interactive(): To run write_clip() in non-interactive mode, either call write_clip() with allow_non_interactive = TRUE, or set the environment variable CLIPR_ALLOW=TRUE chi_and_odds(df) #> # A tibble: 2 × 3 #>   field observed expected #>   <chr>    <dbl>    <dbl> #> 1 Yes         34      707 #> 2 No          88     1021 #>  #> $chisq.test.result #>  #> 	Chi-squared test for given probabilities #>  #> data:  observed #> X-squared = 8.5886, df = 1, p-value = 0.003383 #>  #>  #> $odds_ratio #>    observed #> 1 0.5579594 #>  #> $odds_interpretation #> [1] "Yes is 1.79224520366423 times less likely to happen in observed than in expected" #>

title: Fetch prior attempts — fetch_prior_attempts

what: Fetches as much student data as possible, preferencing the most recent — fetch_students
title: Fetches as much student data as possible, preferencing the most recent — fetch_students
text: Grabs data possible many students possible. time dependent data (student_progress table) grabs latest non NA data. Note works student_ids, student_demographics student_progress tables loaded, either retention.data package .rda files.

title: Fetches as much student data as possible, preferencing the most recent — fetch_students

what: Gets a beefed up table of student data by session based on course — fetch_student_session_summary_from_course
title: Gets a beefed up table of student data by session based on course — fetch_student_session_summary_from_course
text: Given course filtering returns data table one row per student per session much demographic, retention academic data possible. default includes flags concerns: course requirement, low activity, non submission prior performance. must retention.data package loaded work, equivalent tables. calculated fields worth explaining: progress_rate ratio passing grades (PS, CR, DI, HD) grades pass_rate ratio passing grades finalised grades fail_rate ratio failing grades (FL, FW) grades fw_rate ratio FW (fail non submission) grades

code: fetch_student_session_summary_from_course(   course_filter_string = ".",   concerns = c("course requirement", "low activity", "non submission",     "prior performance") )

what: Gets a overall demographic summary by subject — fetch_subject_demographic_summary
title: Gets a overall demographic summary by subject — fetch_subject_demographic_summary
text: Returns summary basic key demographics breakdown based selection subjects. Currently key demographics selected function Low SES, Australian Indigenous, Regional First Family

title: Gets a overall demographic summary by subject — fetch_subject_demographic_summary
code: fetch_subject_demographic_summary(   subject_string,   by_session = TRUE,   sessions = NULL,   include_withdrawn = FALSE,   domestic_only = TRUE )

title: Gets a overall demographic summary by subject — fetch_subject_demographic_summary
